trashday.storage

Class SessionDao

  • java.lang.Object
    • trashday.storage.SessionDao

  • public class SessionDao
extends Object
    Trash Day data access object for Alexa Session.
    Author:
    J. Todd Baldwin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_DESC
      Session attribute key to store user text description of actions that require a Yes/No confirmation
      static String SESSION_ATTR_CONFIRM_INTENT
      Session attribute key to store intent names that require a Yes/No confirmation
      static String SESSION_ATTR_INTENT_LOG
      Session attribute key to store a log of intents performed
      static String SESSION_ATTR_INTENT_LOG_UPDATED
      Session attribute key to store a flag when intent log is updated so we know to store it later to Dynamo DB
      static String SESSION_ATTR_OVERALL_HELP_CARD_SENT
      Session attribute key to store if overall help card is already sent in this session.
      static String SESSION_ATTR_SCHEDULE
      Session attribute key to store user's Schedule
      static String SESSION_ATTR_SCHEDULE_HELP_CARD_SENT
      Session attribute key to store if Schedule help card is already sent in this session.
      static String SESSION_ATTR_SCHEDULE_IN_PROGRESS
      Session attribute key to store user is currently configuring their Schedule.
      static String SESSION_ATTR_TIMEZONE
      Session attribute key to store user's TimeZone
      static String SESSION_ATTR_TIMEZONE_HELP_CARD_SENT
      Session attribute key to store if Time Zone help card is already sent in this session.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SessionDao

        public SessionDao(com.amazon.speech.speechlet.Session session)
        Create data access object for a given Session
        Parameters:
        session - Session The Alexa Session that we will be using to store Trash Day information.

    • Method Detail

      • getConfirmationDescription

        public String getConfirmationDescription()
        Get session attribute that contains a description of the confirmation action currently in progress.
        Returns:
        String description

      • getConfirmationIntent

        public String getConfirmationIntent()
        Get session attribute that contains the intent name of the confirmation action currently in progress. This is the string the application uses to know what action to call on a user's "Yes" response.
        Returns:
        String intent name

      • getIntentLog

        public IntentLog getIntentLog()
        Load a given IntentLog from the Session.
        Returns:
        if existing, the IntentLog

      • getIntentLogUpdated

        public boolean getIntentLogUpdated()
        Load the session attribute that tracks if the intent log has been updated and return true/false.
        Returns:
        true if flag exists and is true

      • getOverallHelpCardSent

        public boolean getOverallHelpCardSent()
        Load the session attribute that tracks if the overall help card has been sent to the user during this session.
        Returns:
        true if flag exists and is true

      • getSchedule

        public Schedule getSchedule()
        Load a given Schedule from the Session.
        Returns:
        if existing, the Schedule

      • getScheduleHelpCardSent

        public boolean getScheduleHelpCardSent()
        Load the session attribute that tracks if the schedule help card has been sent to the user during this session.
        Returns:
        true if flag exists and is true

      • getScheduleConfigInProgress

        public boolean getScheduleConfigInProgress()
        Load the session attribute that tracks if we are currently in a conversation with the user about configuring the schedule. Used to differentiate from one-shot "Alexa, tell Trash Day, to add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm." or user is answering our prompt with "Add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm."
        Returns:
        true if flag exists and is true

      • getTimeZone

        public TimeZone getTimeZone()
        Load a given TimeZone from the Session.
        Returns:
        if existing, the TimeZone

      • getTimeZoneHelpCardSent

        public boolean getTimeZoneHelpCardSent()
        Load the session attribute that tracks if the time zone help card has been sent to the user during this session.
        Returns:
        true if flag exists and is true

      • getUserId

        public String getUserId()
        Get the user id from the current Session. Use this information to read/write Dynamo DB database object per-user.
        Returns:
        String user ID

      • incrementIntentLog

        public void incrementIntentLog(LocalDateTime ldtRequest,
                               String intentName)
        When user completes a Trash Day action, we increment an entry in the intent log stored in the current session attributes.
        Parameters:
        ldtRequest - LocalDateTime this request occurred, so we know what year-week to log this activity.
        intentName - String of the activity user performed.

      • setConfirmationDescription

        public void setConfirmationDescription(String description)
        Set session attribute that contains a description of the confirmation action currently in progress.
        Parameters:
        description - String that is a name for what function to perform if/when the user answers "Yes" to performing this action.

      • setConfirmationIntent

        public void setConfirmationIntent(String intentName)
        Set session attribute that contains the intent name of the confirmation action currently in progress. This is the string the application uses to know what action to call on a user's "Yes" response.
        Parameters:
        intentName - String that represents what function to call if/when the user answers "Yes" to performing this action.

      • setIntentLog

        public void setIntentLog(IntentLog intentLog)
        Save a given IntentLog to the Session.
        Parameters:
        intentLog - IntentLog to be saved

      • setOverallHelpCardSent

        public void setOverallHelpCardSent()
        Set the session attribute that tracks if the overall help card has been sent to the user during this session.

      • setSchedule

        public void setSchedule(Schedule schedule)
        Save a given Schedule to the Session.
        Parameters:
        schedule - Schedule to be saved

      • setScheduleHelpCardSent

        public void setScheduleHelpCardSent()
        Set the session attribute that tracks if the schedule help card has been sent to the user during this session.

      • setScheduleConfigInProgress

        public void setScheduleConfigInProgress()
        Set the session attribute that tracks if we are currently in a conversation with the user about configuring the schedule. Used to differentiate from one-shot "Alexa, tell Trash Day, to add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm." or user is answering our prompt with "Add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm."

      • setTimeZone

        public void setTimeZone(TimeZone timeZone)
        Save a given TimeZone to the Session.
        Parameters:
        timeZone - TimeZone to be saved

      • setTimeZoneHelpCardSent

        public void setTimeZoneHelpCardSent()
        Set the session attribute that tracks if the time zone help card has been sent to the user during this session.

      • clearConfirmationIntent

        public void clearConfirmationIntent()
        Remove session attribute that contains the intent name of the confirmation action currently in progress. This is the string the application uses to know what action to call on a user's "Yes" response.

      • clearConfirmationDescription

        public void clearConfirmationDescription()
        Remove session attribute that contains a description of the confirmation action currently in progress.

      • clearConfirmationData

        public void clearConfirmationData()
        Remove both session attributes that contain a description and intent name of the confirmation action currently in progress.

        Clear IntentLog from the Session.

        public void clearScheduleConfigInProgress()

Used to differentiate from one-shot "Alexa, tell Trash Day, to add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm." or user is answering our prompt with "Add mail pickup on Monday at 4pm."
